New Records: Trent Boult became the first New Zealander to take 50 wickets in a World Cup.
Rachin Ravindra scored the fastest half-century (22 balls) in this World Cup.
Mitchell Santner recorded the second-most economical ten-over spell in the tournament with 16 wickets at an average of 24.68.
Key Match Events: New Zealand won the match by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining.
Kusal Perera's dismissal for 51 off 28 balls left Sri Lanka struggling at 70 for 5 in the first powerplay.
Maheesh Theekshana and Dilshan Madushanka formed a 43-run partnership, the highest tenth-wicket stand for Sri Lanka in World Cup history.
Trent Boult took crucial early wickets, including Kusal Mendis and Kusal Perera, to disrupt Sri Lanka's chase.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand opted to bowl, considering the weather conditions and their team setup.
Sri Lanka made a change by bringing in Chamika Karunaratne for Kasun Rajitha.
Lockie Ferguson was set to return to the XI, with Tim Southee also in line to play after a challenging previous game.
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult was named Player of the Match for his impactful performance with both bat and ball.
Mitchell Santner's bowling and leadership were praised, especially his ability to dictate terms and manage pressure.
The match win boosted New Zealand's net run rate, putting them in a strong position for the semis.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw historical comparisons, such as Sri Lanka's highest tenth-wicket stand and Mitchell Santner's unique bowling style.
Weather conditions and potential rain interruptions were a factor, impacting the match dynamics.
